adjective.description: (of an object or material) able to resume its normal shape spontaneously after contraction, dilatation, or distortion.

noun.description: Cord, tape, or fabric, woven with strips of rubber, which returns to its original length or shape after being stretched.

origin: Mid 17th century (originally describing a gas in the sense expanding spontaneously to fill the available space): from modern Latin elasticus, from Greek elastikos propulsive, from elaunein to drive.
